abstracts.cdata!:
The First Structural Adjustment Project
            will provide support for the Government's program of
            economic recovery outlined in a Letter of Developmental
            Policies from the Government to the Bank. This program is
            designed to diversify the export base, encourage efficient
            import substitution, adjust incentives and income policies,
            improve the public sector's financial performance and
            strengthen the Government's economic planning and
            monitoring capability. Foreign exchange will be used for
            essential imports. Counterpart funds will be used for
            development purposes in the Government budget. The principal
            risk relates to the capacity of the Government to implement
            the program within the agreed time framework.
